item.title: Rosie add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Don't let go too soon, but don't hold on too long." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Rosie add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "...the big things - how we think, what we value - those you must choose yourself. You can't let anyone - or any society - determine those for you." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Rosie add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "The most important thing in life is to learn how to give out love, and to let it come in." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Rosie add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "When I was 5 years old, my mother always told me that happiness was the key to life. When I went to school, they asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up. I wrote down ‘happy’. They told me I didn’t understand the assignment, and I told them they didn’t understand life." -- John Lennon

item.title: Rosie add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Rosie add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "We'll be Friends Forever, won't we, Pooh?' asked Piglet. Even longer,' Pooh answered." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Rosie add a quote by Muhammad Ali
item.description: "Friendship is the hardest thing in the world to explain. It's not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything." -- Muhammad Ali

item.title: Rosie add a quote by Jon Katz
item.description: "I think if I've learned anything about friendship, it's to hang in, stay connected, fight for them, and let them fight for you. Don't walk away, don't be distracted, don't be too busy or tired, don't take them for granted. Friends are part of the glue that holds life and faith together. Powerful stuff." -- Jon Katz

item.title: Rosie add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "You can go through life and make new friends every year - every month practically - but there was never any substitute for those friendships of childhood that survive into adult years. Those are the ones in which we are bound to one another with hoops of steel." -- Alexander McCall Smith

item.title: Rosie add a quote by Bernard Meltzer
item.description: "A true friend is someone who thinks that you are a good egg even though he knows that you are slightly cracked." -- Bernard Meltzer

item.title: Rosie add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "There is no experience like having children.’ That’s all. There is no substitute for it. You cannot do it with a friend. You cannot do it with a lover. If you want the experience of having complete responsibility for another human being, and to learn how to love and bond in the deepest way, then you should have children." -- Mitch Albom
